result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler J. REED was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, Fentanyl, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs paid from cash bail.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Have no contact with David Radant and Thomas Fagen except with approval through probation agent.

Provide DNA sample

timeConds.notes: Each year on probation, complete fifty (50) hours of community service work possibly enducating others in this area.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, Fentanyl
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler J. REED

Letter from Attorney Maloney to Judge Fox regarding restitution dated 05-26-15.
$9,482.00 balance of cash bail paid for restitution by check instruction No. CR 57.

It is hereby ordered, for the reasons stated on the record on November 12, 2014, that $9,482 cash bail is to be applied to funeral expenses.  Paymnet to be sent to Mr. & Mrs. Dennis Vogel, 4938 Morgan Drive, Manitowoc, WI 54220.
Cover letter.
It is hereby ordered, for the reasons stated on the record on November 12, 2014, that the $10,000 cash bail is to be applied to the restitution owing in the above case.
From Ann Bajdan, Victim Witness Coordinator to Judge Fox with restitution information and funeral expense documentation attached.
for records from WI DOJ.
Judgment of Conviction Sentence Withheld, Probation Ordered.  Duplicate original delivered to DOC and Sheriff.

State files an Amended Information charging Delivery of Schedule I or II narcotics, fentanyl, contrary to Section 961.41(1)(a) of the Wisconsin Statutes.  Motion granted.  
No contest plea to the amended charge.  Convicted.  Sentencing hearing is set for 11-12-14 at 9:00 a.m.  
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights. 
Minutes

Stipulation and Order Amending Conditions of Bail.
The court approves of the above stipulation and hereby orders that the bail condition in the above matter requiring the defendant to check in daily at the Manitowoc Police Department by 6:00 p.m. is hereby amended to require the daily check in to take place by 8:00 p.m.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 10-02-14 at 11:00 a.m.

Stipulatio nand Order Amending Conditions of Bail.
The Court approves the stipulation and hereby orders that the bail conditions in the above matter be amended to allow the defendant to travel outside the State of Wisconsin from August 26 to September 2, 2014, and during that time he is relieved of his requirement to check in daily at the Manitowoc City  Police Department.
Copy to DA and City PD.
Motion and Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 08-19-14 at 3:00 p.m.
Plea date is set for 10-02-14 at 11:00 a.m.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Minutes.

Stipulation and Order for Substitution of Counsel.
The Court approves the stipulation and orders that Brian Maloney be substituted in place of Robin Shellow as attorney for the defendant.
Waiver of preliminary hearing set for 07-16-14 at 3:30 p.m.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives his statutory time limits within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Preliminary hearing is set for 07-18-14 at 2:30 p.m.
Minutes.
Re:  Christopher T. Vogel, on 05-08-14.

Defendant in custody.   
The State informs the Court the defendant will be charged with the crime of 1st degree reckless homicide.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 06-30-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $10,000.00 cash with the conditions that defendant must report to the Manitowoc City Police Department, daily by 6:00 p.m., defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and defendant must remain in the State of Wisconsin unless he has prior court approval.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.  
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.  
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail
